title: Instagram and Facebook will force their checkout experience on Shops soon
text: Meta announced today that it will be phasing out onboarding of new Shops without checkout on Facebook and Instagram enabled. Beginning June 5, onboarding of new shops via Commerce Manager and Shopify will only be with checkout on Facebook and Instagram enabled.

title: Mark Zuckerberg gushes over Meta's AI ambitions — as metaverse loses $4B
text: Meta boss Mark Zuckerberg spoke glowingly about the company's ambitions for artificial intelligence on Wednesday after the Facebook and Instagram parent's metaverse division lost nearly $4 billion -- marring an otherwise strong quarter.

title: US appeals court rejects bid by states to revive antitrust lawsuit against Facebook

title: Meta's Mark Zuckerberg: Facebook founder is failing to keep up with the times
text: When Mark Zuckerberg decided to rename Facebook to Meta in October 2021, it was more than just a rebranding exercise; it was an attempt to stake his claim as supreme leader of the trendy tech thing at the time: The Metaverse. Such was his conviction that the metaverse was the future that he staked tens of billions of dollars and his company's reputation on it being the next big thing.

title: U.S. stocks open higher after Meta earnings, GDP data
text: U.S. stocks opened higher Thursday after earnings results from Facebook parent Meta Platforms Inc. META and fresh data on economic growth. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA was up 0.3% soon after the opening bell, while the S&P 500 SPX rose 0.6% and the technology-heavy Nasdaq Composite COMP gained 0.9%, according to FactSet data, at last check.

title: Facebook parent Meta Platforms maintains bullish sentiment following 1Q earnings beat, analysts say
text: Sentiment remains bullish for Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ:FB) as its focuses on making 2023 a year of efficiency for the company, including slimming down its workforce and increasing expenditure on augmented reality (AR) platform Reality Labs, according to TickMill Group market analyst James Harte. The owner of social network and messaging services Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp broke a three-quarter earnings losing streak with the release of its 1Q 2023 financials on Wednesday, Harte said in a note, adding that the breakdown of the numbers “is encouraging for shareholders.

title: Nasdaq set for strong open buoyed by Facebook parent Meta Platform's bumper results
text: 7:50am: More positive tech earnings   The Nasdaq is likely to lead the gains when Thursday trading gets underway after shares in Facebook parent company Meta Platforms spiked after the close on Wednesday on the back of its first-quarter results, while investors will also be eyeing a US GDP report. Contracts for the Nasdaq-100 rose 0.9% in pre-market trading, supported by a 12% gain in Meta Platforms' shares, while futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average added 0.4% and those for the broader S&P 500 index rose 0.5%.

title: Fanatics moves one step closer to IPO, hiring Meta's head of investor relations
text: Fanatics hires Meta IR head Deborah Crawford, who had also run investor relations at Netflix, as the sports platform company takes another step closer to IPO.

title: Facebook-parent Meta soars as AI powers return to growth
text: Meta Platforms Inc's shares rose 11% on Thursday after the Facebook owner dazzled Wall Street with an earnings report that showed progress towards the "year of efficiency" and a return to growth, thanks to AI-powered content recommendations.
